title: Why are so many people siding with Riot?
body:
The tribunal is just awful, it's one sided and automated. I literally got banned in this game without even swearing and using bad words. I got banned for criticizing an Orianna support who was intentionally stealing cs and feeding. So somehow my comments on her trolling are worse than her being silent all game and intentionally feeding by diving turrents and taking cs. 

It turns out that you can get suspended in this game by the numbers of reports and the amount of words that you put in chat. You don't even have to say bad words to get banned. I heard stories where people got banned for saying ''gg'' 

Anyways, I am not going to make a new account, I lost all my hard work, even though I didn't get in trouble for my behavior in the game for over 5 months. 

Just remember guys the 3 month rule is a myth, I thought that I was immune from a perma ban, but guess not, guess Riot doesn't care about their costumers. 

If I am such a bad person than why wasn't I banned 5 or 4 or 3 or 2 or 1 years ago? 
People in this game are sociopaths and they don't care that I'm going through emotional stress right now. 
People even went as far as killed themselves because Riot doesn't care for human life.

replies.body: Most the time, its not us siding with Riot. It's more like "the other side" doesn't understands what it means to be a decent human being and blame Riot for everything else.
It's a one sided system. The tribunal is simply broken and should be replaced with something else.

that is what you fail to understand. You think it is one sided, but it is more of one sided for everyone (everyone is judged independantly based on their own behavior / history). 

The tribunal WAS broken (well, it had problems but I guess I wouldn't call it broken), which is why the Instant Feedback System was introduced.

You threatened to go AFK, you called for reports 3 or 4 times (your own report is enough), and you made a bad experience worse for the rest of your team by complaining endlessly about Orianna. 

If Orianna was a troll, you gave her *exactly* what she wanted. Way to reward a troll. There are better ways to handle this situation and you know it. 

I suspect this wasn't your only game shown either, but it certainly is an accurate one against you.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PwnjRX5z,comment-id=000000020002,timestamp=2017-01-19T15:43:09.964+0000)

and yet the troll won't get punished a guy who says WORDS in a VIDEO GAME does. how this makes sense? it doesn't. typical riot fanboys

> [{quoted}](name=Queen Incest,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PwnjRX5z,comment-id=0000000200020000,timestamp=2017-01-19T16:02:52.052+0000)
>
> and yet the troll won't get punished a guy who says WORDS in a VIDEO GAME does. how this makes sense? it doesn't. typical riot fanboys

2 wrongs don't make 1 right. If Orianna was a troll, sure they would deserve a punishment too. However just because they are a troll (let's assume they really were), it doesn't suddenly makes it okay for you to go ape shit on them; no one is suddenly above common sense and law just because there's another who's being an idiot.

Also, what's this "WORDS in a VIDEO GAME" suppose to mean, so if I curse some very horrible things to another person (such as (not directed to anybody) "I hope you die a painful one getting run over by a truck while your family watches on the side"), is it okay just because the media we're current on is a game? Of course not. Similarly, spamming and verbal abuse isn't pleasant either.

Why does video games hold so little value in your opinion? Do you treat books, board games, movies, sports and whatever entertainment have you the same way like you do with games?

Secondly, again, having thick skins is 1 thing, basic human decency is another matter entirely. Should we have thicker skins? Yeah. Should we act civil and respectful towards others? Yeah.

Growing up means being able to think and take responsibilities of what you do, growing up also means learning respect and manners. It's only babies who think they could bad mouth others and get away with it because it's a "video game" or whatever. What you're preaching isn't growing up at all.

yeah and I respect people irl, I hold doors open for people(sometimes), I say thank you to the waiter and the cashier. That is HUMAN decency, not "_digital_" decency.

> [{quoted}](name=Queen Incest,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PwnjRX5z,comment-id=0000000200020000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-19T17:55:49.234+0000)
>
> yeah and I respect people irl, I hold doors open for people(sometimes), I say thank you to the waiter and the cashier. That is HUMAN decency, not "_digital_" decency.

You do realize that you're interacting with HUMANS when you're online as well right? That's what the P in PvP and PvE stands for: Player. Just because you can say it doesn't mean you should. If it's not helpful or constructive then there's no need to press Enter. As for trash talk, even that has its limits, and many players in other sports have received fines and punishments for taking it too far. From [Ulanopo's Knowledge Base](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4086541&page=5#post43595629): 

>**Trash talk is part of all competitive sports. It happens all the time in the pros.**

>Yes and no. Yes, trash talk occurs, but it has definite limits. Most of the things that are punished in game (racial, ethnic and homophobic slurs, sexism, etc.) would also earn you a hefty fine in professional sports.

>A Tumblr List of NBA Fines (http://nbafines.tumblr.com/)
(My personal favorite on that site is this indefinite suspension (http://nbafines.tumblr.com/post/1010368028/3-12-96-the-nba-suspended-mahmoud-abdul-rauf-den), simply for refusing to stand during the National Anthem.)

>A List of NFL Fines for Taunting (http://www.spotrac.com/fines-tracker/nfl/all-years/fines/taunting/)

>NBC Article on Fines Agreed to by the NFLPA (http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2012/12/01/bizarrely-specific-nfl-fines-come-from-agreed-league-union-schedule/)
"Excessive profanity or other unsportsmanlike conduct triggers a minimum fine of $10,500."

>NHL Office of Player Safety (http://www.nhl.com/ice/eventhome.htm?location=/playersafety)
Brendan Shanahan is the ****ing Bad Santa of the NHL. Did you know that his Office of Player Safety watches every minute of every game, from multiple angles? He sees and hears EVERYTHING, including swearing.

>... and the grand finale!
Marge Schott (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marge_Schott), who was forced out of ownership of the Cincinnati Reds for racist comments and pro-Nazi sentiments.

I understand that it's easier to say things online since we're not talking to people face to face but we should still try to show some common sense and decency when interacting with others. If you're unwilling or unable to interact with others in a neutral or positive (mature and respectful) manner then multiplayer online games are not for you.

It is a just a video game and still you think you need to rage about people which are bad at it. That's sad and poor and i hope you find sth in your life which makes you happy.

Just kidding, stay sad.

Doesn't matter if *you* don't care, the community as a whole does. I wouldn't mind in the least if these boards were filled with people describing their "come to Jesus" moments, but that doesn't mean it should be that way.

The car that doesn't have a parking permit in a patrolled lot gets a ticket, but the guy who speeds on a road the cops have a hard time monitoring gets away with it. How does that make sense?

League hasn't been known as "the game with the most trolls", but rather "the game with the most toxic community." It only makes sense that Riot would prioritize cleaning up its reputation first. Natural Language Processing (a process where computers can understand the context of what's written by people) makes it relatively easy to catch what people say, and so Riot went that way. 

There's no easy and accurate way to detect a troll in the same way there is to check language. That doesn't mean that Riot should just stop checking language while they try and figure out a solution. We've seen intentional feeders show up in Player Behavior complaining about their bans, but we've also seen people genuinely trying get hit by the same system (Support Singed). 

I don't know about you, but I'd rather not put up with the crap that some 11 year old is spouting off thinking they're all big and bad. Grow up and you won't get chat restricted.

Yeah since real life is exactly the same as a video game.

I gave you technical insight into why it is that way as well. Are you going to tell me that real world technical limitations shouldn't effect a video game?

It surprises me that as more and more of our interactions with others become digital there are *still* people who think that these digital interactions somehow are less real than those we have face to face.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PwnjRX5z,comment-id=0000000200020000000100000000,timestamp=2017-01-19T16:44:24.696+0000)

you play a game with some shitty teammates for about 30 minutes than never meet them ever again. calling someone a asshole is different then calling your friend, boss or dad a asshole or so on because the consequences will be bigger.

You meet people you'll never run into again in everyday life too. On the bus, at the gas station, in line at the checkout. If you act that way while driving it's known as road rage. 

And yeah, it can have consequences in the real world too. Do you think the police officer will care that some guy cut you off if you continue to drive terribly afterward? Do you think the store manager will care who started the yelling match?

Being a decent human being isn't hard.

It sucks that you lost your account, but you got plenty of warnings. Why can't you accept that you screwed up, and this is the result of your actions. You making multiple posts on the boards isn't going to make a difference. 

The 3 month rule is a myth, but you also have to show considerable improvement. You saying you thought it was "safe" to be an asshole again just proves that you didn't reform, you were just biding your time. 
Why not make a new acct and turn over a new leaf to not be toxic?  If you do that and focus solely on yourself and your own gameplay, you will get out of Bronze, no problem.

Best of luck to you!
I play the game every other day for the past 5 years. When you play as much as I do, warnings happen. But I assure you I'm rarely toxic and I never troll.
I've played the game for four years only one less than you, and haven't received a single warning or punishment.
Because you don't play as many games as me.

B4L5H4 : You've spent about 364 hours on League of Legends which means 15 days of your life.

http://wasted-on-lol.com/

Huh.

Man, I need to play more, it is starting to look bad in comparison to the people that still play a ton.

I have never been punished or warned for bad behavior.
Some places use a '.' instead of a ',' for numbers. 2,540 hours is 105.8 days

Oh, I'm aware of that.

Honestly, I didn't even notice it was a decimal and just assumed it was a comma. 

 I've been playing the game for quite a long time, so I just interpreted the number as would be appropriate.
The site is slightly inaccurate recently, you may have spent more, but for rough estimates its a great site. i have a friend who is up to 3500 hours XD.
